intro: Anthericum machupiccense, commonly known as the Machupiccu lily, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in Peru. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are broad and strap-like, often forming a dense rosette at the base. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Anthericum machupiccense is considered a vulnerable species.
